messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: Ruby. My Garmin is logging consistently high intensity minutes, even on rest days. I suspect it's my POTS/long COVID. My current health management is ad-hoc. I need a proper medical review. My supplement list is attached.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: attached: Rohans_Supplement_Regime.pdf

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Hi [Rohan], thank you for sharing this. We've received your supplement list. Are you experiencing any other symptoms like dizziness or shortness of breath alongside the high intensity minutes? I am flagging this for Dr. Warren to review immediately as Priority 1.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: Some dizziness on standing. No SOB.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Understood. Thank you for clarifying. Dr. Warren will review and we will come back with a plan.

messages.speaker: Dr. Warren
messages.message: [Rohan], Dr. Warren here. I've reviewed your initial submission. The symptoms and data strongly suggest autonomic dysfunction (Pillar 1). To proceed with a clinical-grade strategy, we must consolidate your complete medical records from all previous specialists. This is non-negotiable to ensure safety and avoid redundant testing.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: Acknowledged. How long will that take?

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: The timeline can vary depending on the clinics' response speed, but we will manage the entire process, including phone calls and faxes. We typically aim to have all records within 2-3 weeks. We will provide you with daily updates on the status.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: My wife also needs a referral to a top-tier dermatologist in the Bay Area for a persistent rash. Can you handle that?

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Absolutely. That is part of our family service. Could you please provide her name and DOB so I can create a sub-profile for her? We will research the best specialists at UCSF and Stanford and come back with recommendations and our rationale for each.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: [Wife's Name], DOB: [XX/XX/XXXX].

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Thank you. We are on it.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Good morning. We have created the initial shell for your Health Optimization Plan in our secure portal. For now, it's mostly empty, but it's where our entire strategy will live. The first step for you is a comprehensive Lifestyle Consultation with our Head of Performance, Dr. Advik, to begin populating it.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: When?

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: I will check his clinical schedule and come back to you with options that fit your stated preference for mornings.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Update on your wife's dermatology referral: We have identified three leading dermatologists. Dr. Alice Ma at Stanford is a national expert on inflammatory skin conditions. Her waitlist is typically 6 months, but we have a relationship with her office. Would you like us to pursue an appointment with her?

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: Yes, do that.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: I have not heard about scheduling the Advik consult.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: My apologies. I am coordinating with his schedule now. I will have options for you by EOD.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: [Rohan], Dr. Advik has an opening on Feb 1st at 3 PM or Feb 2nd at 11 AM. Do either of those work?

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: Neither work. Check the week of Feb 5th. Mornings only.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Understood. I see a potential slot on Feb 5th at 10 AM. I've placed a soft hold on it. Please let me know if I should confirm.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: Yes, confirm the Feb 5th slot.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Confirmed. The calendar invitation has been sent with a preliminary agenda.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Good morning. A thought from our team: while we gather records, understanding your current state is useful. Would you be open to completing a 3-day food log? No need to change anything, just record what you eat. This gives our nutritionist, Carla, a baseline for Pillar 3.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: Fine. Send me the template.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: It's a simple notes app format; just text or photos. Whatever is easiest for you. I've shared a secure note link.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: To get a head start on the record retrieval for Pillar 1, could you please add your assistant, Suzane, to this chat? We can then liaise with her directly for the administrative details.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: System Message: Rohan has added Suzane to the group.

messages.speaker: Suzane
messages.message: Hi all.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Welcome, Suzane. Could you please provide the clinic names and locations for [Rohan]'s cardiologists in Singapore and New York? We will prepare the necessary medical release forms and send them to you for his signature.

messages.speaker: Suzane
messages.message: The details have been uploaded to our shared drive.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Thank you, Suzane. We are preparing the forms now. They will be with you this afternoon.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: I have a last minute flight to Chicago tomorrow. Any recommended healthy restaurants near The Loop for a business dinner?

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Of course. I'll research options that can accommodate a clean, low-inflammatory meal. One moment.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Based on your preferences, I recommend "True Food Kitchen". It focuses on an anti-inflammatory menu. I've attached their menu. Would you like me to make a reservation for you?

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: Yes. 7:30 PM for 4 people.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Done. Reservation is confirmed. It's in your calendar.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: attached: Food_Log_Day1.png

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Received, thank you. Forwarding to Carla.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Hi Suzane, just a gentle follow-up on the signed release forms. We need them to formally initiate the requests.

messages.speaker: Suzane
messages.message: He is traveling. I will get them signed as soon as he lands this evening.

messages.speaker: Suzane
messages.message: attached: Signed_Release_Forms.pdf

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Perfect, thank you. We are dispatching the requests now via secure fax and courier.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Update on your wife's dermatology appointment: Dr. Ma's office has agreed to see her. They have an opening due to a cancellation on Feb 15th. We have tentatively booked it.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: Excellent. Confirm it.

messages.speaker: Rohan
messages.message: attached: Food_Log_Day2.png

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Got it. Thanks.

messages.speaker: Ruby
messages.message: Status Update (Pillar

events.decision: Confirm appointment with Dr. Advik for Feb 5th at 10 AM.

events.decision: Member to complete a 3-day food log.
events.reason: To provide a baseline for the nutritionist (Carla) for Pillar 3 of the health plan.

events.decision: Coordinate with member's assistant to obtain signed medical release forms.
events.reason: To formally request and retrieve the member's complete medical records from previous cardiologists.

events.decision: Confirm dermatology appointment for member's wife with Dr. Alice Ma on Feb 15th.
